Description: Originally two fragments of an ostracon from a pottery vessel, now glued together, showing text at the outside on the upper part of the shoulder. Two columns of seven lines of hieratic text in black ink partly covered in a crust of salt, obscuring the text.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), E14.1, upper level
Bibliographic references: Spencer 1997 / Amara West I, The Architectural Report (p. 71)
